DataElement.preferredName: Troponin I Laboratory Procedure Performed 3 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 3 decimal place microgram per liter numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of troponin I in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of the three polypeptide chains that make up the TROPONIN complex. It inhibits F-actin-myosin interactions._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of the three polypeptide chains that make up the TROPONIN complex. It inhibits F-actin-myosin interactions.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Troponin I, troponin T, and troponin C are the three closely associated subunits of the troponin complex of thin filaments in muscle.  The complex serves as a calcium-sensitive switch that regulates muscle contraction.  In the absence of calcium, Troponin I binds actin, inhibits actomyosin ATPase activity, and inhibits F-actin-myosin interactions.  The troponin I gene family comprises three isoforms: skeletal TNI-fast, skeletal TNI-slow, and TNI-cardiac.  (from OMIM 191044, 191043, 191042 and NCI)
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 3 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
